channel.title: BUbreakingSectionTwo
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from BUbreakingSectionTwo, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: AI governance becomes a board mandate as operational reality lags
item.description: Fortune 500 companies are racing to formalize AI oversight.

item.title: The American voter is angry about one thing above all and Trump’s tariffs are in the crossfire, Goldman’s chief political economist says
item.description: Cost of living is the issue driving the midterms. Trump calls affordability a "hoax" when Democrats say it, but his tariff regime is showing cracks.

item.title: European Leaders Face Off Over Whether to Tap Russian Frozen Assets for Ukraine
item.description: The European Council convenes on Thursday, and at stake is a contentious deal to back Ukraine and its war effort. The final decision is a major test o...

item.title: U.S. Government Admits Liability in Deadly D.C.-Area Air Collision
item.description: A federal court filing says the Army crew piloting a Black Hawk helicopter could have avoided the nighttime accident in January if it had been able to...

item.title: 6 Takeaways From Trump’s Address to the Nation
item.description: In an 18-minute address, President Trump said the economy was booming despite the public’s consistent concerns about prices. Here are six takeaways fr...

item.title: North Korea stole a record amount of crypto—again: report estimates its hackers’ 2025 haul at $2 billion
item.description: The country has now pilfered about $7 billion in crypto all-time.

item.title: U.K. startup CellVoyant debuts AI platform that could radically reduce the cost of cell-based therapies such as CAR-T immunotherapy for cancer
item.description: CellVoyant says its FateView platform can reduce the cost of producing viable cells for therapy by up to 80%

item.title: Truth Social Parent to Merge With Nuclear Fusion Firm in $6 Billion Deal
item.description: The deal would be a total transformation for Trump Media & Technology Group, the social media and crypto company in which President Trump holds a larg...

item.title: Want a job in AI-era tech? Forget prestigious degrees—tech leaders want to see your GitHub projects and internships
item.description: As entry-level tech hiring slows, one CEO warns avoiding AI skills would be like “taking crazy pills”—and says Gen Z must show real proof of ability.

item.title: The Putin Confidant Who Pushed Back Against Russia’s War in Ukraine
item.description: Dmitri N. Kozak had worked with President Vladimir V. Putin for three decades before quitting in September. His associates described his break with th...

item.title: Australia Mourns the Youngest Victim of the Bondi Beach Shooting
item.description: Sydney’s devastated Jewish community gathered for the funeral of “Matilda Bee,” an ebullient, smiling 10-year-old girl.

item.title: Two U.K. Police Forces Pledge to Arrest People Who Chant ‘Globalize the Intifada’
item.description: The police in London and Manchester said they would take a “more assertive” approach after the Bondi Beach massacre and a terrorist attack at a Britis...

item.title: A Militant’s Transformation
item.description: Ahmed Al-Sharaa, a former Al Qaeda ally, is now president of Syria. We look at his transformation, and whether he can transform his country, too.

item.title: European Leaders Face Off Over Whether to Tap Russian Frozen Assets for Ukraine
item.description: The European Council convenes on Thursday, and at stake is a contentious deal to back Ukraine and its war effort. The final decision is a major test o...

item.title: Pope Leo Appoints Bishop Ronald Hicks to Succeed Timothy Dolan
item.description: The appointment of Bishop Ronald A. Hicks is expected to bring a markedly different leadership style to New York’s archdiocese.
